com.thomsonreuters.upa.valueadd.common

Class SelectableBiDirectionalQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thomsonreuters.upa.valueadd.common.SelectableBiDirectionalQueue

  • public class SelectableBiDirectionalQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    A selectable bidirectional queue used to communicate events between the Reactor and Worker threads. To be useful this queue needs a local and remote end. Initially this class operates on the local end of the queues. To operate on the remote end of the queues, call remote().

    • Constructor Summary

      Normal constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • isShutDown

        public boolean isShutDown()
        Returns whether or not the queue is shutdown.
        Returns:
        true if the queue is shutdown, or false if it isn't

      • readChannel

        public java.nio.channels.SelectableChannel readChannel()
        Returns the SelectableChannel of the queue that can be registered with a selector.
        Returns:
        SelectableChannel of the queue

      • readQueueSize

        public int readQueueSize()
        Returns the size of the read queue.
        Returns:
        the size of the read queue

      • writeQueueSize

        public int writeQueueSize()
        Returns the size of the write queue.
        Returns:
        the size of the write queue

      • read

        public VaNode read()
        Reads a ReactorEvent sent from the remote end of the queue. Once the selector fires for the key (registered on readChannel() ), read should be called until it returns null or readQueueSize() is zero. This will reset the internal notifier and allow the selector to fire again later.
        Returns:
        ReactorEvent

      • write

        public boolean write(VaNode node)
        Writes a ReactorEvent to the remote end of the queue.
        Parameters:
        node - ReactorEvent to write to remote end of queue
        Returns:
        true if write succeeded, false otherwise

      • remote

        public SelectableBiDirectionalQueue remote()
        Helper method which will create a new SelectableBiDirectionalQueue that uses the remote end of this queue. Repeated calls will return the same object, since there is only one remote end of this queue. The user can obtain the same result by calling the SelectableBiDirectionalQueue(SelectableBiDirectionalQueue) constructor.
        Returns:
        a SelectableBiDirectionalQueue that uses the remote end of this queue

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the selectable bidirectional queue.
